ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: ID for the Experiment/settings/run
ID for session
Notes: For in-lab subjects, sessionID corresponds to the visit number. For online subjects, sessionID = 1

ElementDescription: Current block number
Notes: 0 = OldNew task portion; blockID begins with 1 for the main task

ElementDescription: Number of trial within current block
ID of left stimulus in the set of all stimuli shown during the task
ID of right stimulus in the set of all stimuli shown during the task
If chosen, did the left stimulus result in a win?
If chosen, did the right stimulus result in a win?
Time elapsed between stimulus onset and subject reponse
Notes: In milliseconds. -999 indicates missed response (subject took longer than 2s)

ElementDescription: Explore-Exploit Task - Subject response key
Notes: During main task: 1 = Left; 2 = Right; -999 = Miss (subject took longer than 2s to respond). During Old/New task: 1 = Old; 2 = New.

ElementDescription: ID of selected stimulus in the set of all stimuli shown during the task
Outcome of selected stimulus
Notes: 0 = selected stimulus loses; 1 = selected stimulus wins; -999 = subject missed resposne

ElementDescription: ID of the Old/New stimulus in the set of all stimuli shown during the task
Has the stimulus presented in an Old/New trial been seen before?
Is the trial a practice trial?
